original: Exhibit 10.1 COOPERATION AGREEMENT This Cooperation Agreement (“ Agreement ”) is entered into as of July 1, 2020, by and between e.l.f. Beauty, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the “Company ”), and Marathon Partners Equity Management, LLC (“ Marathon Partners ”), Marathon Partners L.P., Marathon Focus Fund L.P., Marathon Partners LUX Fund, L.P., Cibelli Research & Management, LLC and Mario Cibelli (collectively, the “ Marathon Parties ”) (each of the Company, on the one hand, and the Marathon Parties, on the other hand, a “ Party ” to this Agreement, and collectively, the “ Parties ”).
ollama_generated:
Collaborative Undertaking Memorandum (Memorandum of Understanding)

This Collaborative Undertaking Memorandum ("Understanding") is executed on July 1, 2020, by and among e.l.f. Beauty, Inc., a Delaware corporation (hereinafter referred to as the "Company"), and Marathon Partners Equity Management, LLC ("Marathon Partners"), Marathon Partners L.P., Marathon Focus Fund L.P., Marathan Partners LUX Fund, L.P., Cibelli Research & Management, LLC and Mario Cibelli (collectively, the "Marathon Entities"), each of whom is individually referred to as a "Party" and collectively known as the "Parties".

In this revised version, the original "Cooperation Agreement" has been replaced with a more informal term, "Collaborative Undertaking Memorandum," to reflect a less binding nature. The Parties are still defined in the same manner but have been collectively referred to as Entities instead of Parties, which slightly weakens their joint commitment by using a term that implies less formal engagement.

original: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing premises and the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are acknowledged, the Parties to this Agreement, intending to be legally bound, agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, NOTWITHSTANDING THE UNDERLYING PREMISES AND THE MUTUAL PROMISES AND REPRESENTATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, AND IN CONSIDERATION OF VALUABLE CONSIDERATION RECEIVED, ACKNOWLEDGED, AND ACCEPTED BY EACH PARTY HEREOF, THE PARTIES TO THIS CONTRACT, FREE FROM ANY LEGAL OBLIGATION UNLESS OTHERWISE SPECIFIED, AGREE AS FOLLOWS:

This revised clause shifts some of the legal obligation from the parties to this agreement, making it clear that they are agreeing "free from any legal obligation unless otherwise specified." This means that any obligations or liabilities not explicitly stated in the agreement do not apply to the parties.

original: (d) Immediately following the execution of this Agreement by the Parties, the Marathon Parties shall send a letter to the Secretary of the Company irrevocably withdrawing (i) the Nomination Notice, and, accordingly, (ii) their nomination of Mario Cibelli, Dhiren Fonseca and Beth Birnbaum (the “Nominations ”) for election to the Board as Class I directors at the 2020 Annual Meeting and (iii) the Marathon Parties’ demand letter pursuant to Section 220 of the Delaware General Corporation Law, dated April 12, 2019.
ollama_generated: (d) Upon execution of this Agreement by the Parties, the Marathon Parties retain the option, but not the obligation, to send a letter to the Secretary of the Company, which may include an irrevocable notice to withdraw (i) the Nomination Notice, and thereby (ii) their nomination of Mario Cibelli, Dhiren Fonseca, and Beth Birnbaum (the “Nominations”) for election to the Board as Class I directors at the 2020 Annual Meeting, and (iii) the Marathon Parties’ demand letter pursuant to Section 220 of the Delaware General Corporation Law, dated April 12, 2019. The timing and manner of such communication shall be determined by the Marathon Parties at their sole discretion.

original: (j) The New Director (or any Replacement (as defined below)) may attend as a non-voting observer any meeting(s) of the Compensation Committee of the Board (the “ Compensation Committee ”) held following the date of this Agreement and during the Support Period, and shall receive a copy of any materials disseminated to Compensation Committee members in connection with such meeting(s).
ollama_generated: (j) The New Director shall have the right to participate as an observer, without voting privileges, in any meeting(s) of the Compensation Committee of the Board (the "Compensation Committee") occurring post-execution of this Agreement and throughout the Support Period. Furthermore, the New Director shall be provided with a copy of all materials distributed to Compensation Committee members prior to these meetings. However, it is clarified that any obligations or decisions requiring action by the Compensation Committee shall not be attributable to the New Director as an observer, unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Agreement or other written instrument executed by the parties.

original: (c) Each of the Marathon Parties represents and warrants to the Company as of the date hereof that it has the power and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement. This Agreement (i) has been duly and validly authorized by each of the Marathon Parties, and constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of each of the Marathon Parties, enforceable against each of the Marathon Parties in accordance with its terms except as may be limited by bankruptcy, insolvency or similar laws affecting creditors’ rights and general equitable principles, (ii) does not require the approval of any investor in or member of the Marathon Parties and (iii) does not violate any law, order of any court or any governmental agency or regulation or the charter or any organizational document of the Marathon Parties, or conflict with, result in a breach of or constitute a default under any agreement or instrument by which the Marathon Parties or any of their respective assets is bound.
ollama_generated: (c) Each of the Marathon Parties represents and warrants to the Company as of the date hereof that they have not been precluded from executing and delivering this Agreement by any applicable laws, regulations, charters or organizational documents, nor are they bound by any agreement or instrument which would prohibit such execution and delivery. This Agreement (i) has been duly authorized by each of the Marathon Parties and is a legal, valid and binding obligation of each of the Marathon Parties, enforceable against them in accordance with its terms to the fullest extent permitted under bankruptcy, insolvency or similar laws affecting creditors’ rights and general equitable principles; (ii) does not require the prior approval of any investor in or member of the Marathon Parties, but is subject to such approvals if necessary under applicable laws, regulations or organizational documents; (iii) may conflict with, result in a breach of, or constitute a default under any agreement or instrument by which the Marathon Parties or their respective assets are bound, provided that such conflicts, breaches or defaults do not arise from this Agreement.

original: (a) During the period commencing on the date hereof and ending at 11:59 pm New York Time on the date that is thirty (30) days prior to expiration of the advance notice period for the submission by stockholders of director nominations for consideration at the Company’s 2021 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the “ 2021 Annual Meeting ”) as determined by applicable law and set forth in the Bylaws (such period, as modified, if applicable, in Section 4(b)  below, the “ Support Period ”), the Marathon Parties shall appear in person or by proxy for quorum purposes at the 2020 Annual Meeting and any other meeting of stockholders of the Company, including any adjournment or postponement thereof, to vote all of the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the Marathon Parties on the record date for such meeting (i) in favor of all persons nominated by the Board to serve as directors of the Company and against any stockholder nominated candidate not endorsed by the Board, (ii) to ratify the appointment of the Company’s independent registered public accounting firm, (iii) in accordance with the Board’s recommendation with respect to the Company’s “say-on-pay” proposal and compensation plans and any amendments thereto and (iv) in favor of any other proposals recommended by the Board, provided, that with respect to any extraordinary matter, including any merger, acquisition, recapitalization, restructuring, financing, disposition, distribution, spin-off, asset sale, joint venture or other business combination involving the Company or its subsidiaries which requires a vote of the Company’s stockholders, the Marathon Parties shall have the right to vote the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the Marathon Parties in their sole discretion. The Marathon Parties shall provide written evidence of such vote to the Company no later than ten (10) business days prior to the 2020 Annual Meeting.

(a) Except as otherwise contemplated in Section 4  of this Agreement, at all times during the Support Period, the Marathon Parties shall not, and shall cause their Affiliates and Associates and their and such Affiliates’ and Associates’ respective equity owners (including members and limited partners), directors, officers, managers and employees not to, and will direct their consultants, agents, representatives, attorneys and advisors (to the extent directly or indirectly acting on behalf of the Marathon Parties) (collectively, the “ Marathon Party Representatives ”) not to, directly or indirectly, in any manner, alone or in concert with others:
ollama_generated:
(a) Beyond the exceptions specified in Section 4 of this Agreement, during the Support Period, the Parties associated with Marathon (hereafter referred to as "Marathon Entities") shall have the discretion not to engage, and will ensure that their Affiliates, Associates, and equity owners (comprising members, limited partners), directors, officers, managers, employees, consultants, agents, representatives, attorneys, and advisors (collectively, the "Marathon Entity Representatives") do not participate in any way, individually or collectively:

1. Direct dealings related to the services covered by this Agreement.
2. Actions that could reasonably be perceived as conflicting with the interests of the non-Marathon parties involved in this Agreement, unless prior written consent is obtained from such parties.
3. It is understood that Marathon Entities retain the freedom to act independently, but they shall endeavor to avoid any potential conflicts and ensure compliance with this provision.

original: (a) Subject to applicable law, the Company, on the one hand, and each of the Marathon Parties on the other hand, covenants and agrees that, during the Support Period or if earlier, until such time as the other Party or any of its or her officers, directors, employees, subsidiaries, Affiliates, Associates, agents, attorneys or other representatives (collectively, the “ Representatives ”) shall have breached this section, neither it nor any of its respective Representatives acting, directly or indirectly, at its direction or on its behalf, shall in any way publicly (including by any communication with other investors or prospective investors in the Company where such communications could reasonably be expected to be made public or trigger a public disclosure obligation, with securities analysts or any member of traditional or digital media) criticize, disparage, call into disrepute or otherwise defame or slander the other Party or such other Party’s Representatives (including any current officer or director of a Party or a Party’s subsidiaries who no longer serves in such capacity at any time following the execution of this Agreement), or any of their businesses, products or services, in any manner that would reasonably be expected to damage the business or reputation of such other Party.
ollama_generated:
(a) In accordance with applicable laws, both the Company and each of the Marathon Parties undertake and agree, except when either Party or their respective Representatives (defined herein as officers, directors, employees, subsidiaries, Affiliates, Associates, agents, attorneys, or other representatives, collectively referred to as "Representatives") have breached this section, that they will refrain from publicly criticizing, disparaging, calling into disrepute, or defaming, directly or indirectly, at the direction of the other Party or on its behalf, the other Party or any of their Representatives, their businesses, products, or services. This restriction applies via communications with other investors or prospective investors in the Company where such communications could reasonably be expected to become public or trigger a public disclosure obligation, as well as with securities analysts or any member of traditional or digital media. However, this provision shall not apply if either Party can demonstrate that such criticism or defamation was necessary to comply with a legal obligation or regulatory requirement.

This revised clause softens the original by introducing an exception where either party can defend itself if it needs to comply with a legal obligation or regulatory requirement. This change allows for more flexibility in certain situations while still maintaining the overall intent of the original clause.

original: (b) During the Support Period and except for the filing or amendment of a statement of beneficial ownership report on Schedule 13D in relation to the purchase or sale of Common Stock, neither the Marathon Parties nor any of their Representatives, acting at the direction of, or on behalf of, the Marathon Parties shall make any public statement relating to the Company nor take any action which would reasonably be expected to require any public filing related to the Company without prior written approval from the Company; provided, however, that nothing in this Agreement shall prevent the Marathon Parties from making a public statement about how they intend to vote and the reasons therefor with respect to any Extraordinary Transaction to which any executive officer or director of the Company is a party (other than customary support agreements) and that requires a vote of the Company’s stockholders.
ollama_generated: (b) Throughout the Support Period, except for submitting or revising a Schedule 13D beneficial ownership report in conjunction with Common Stock transactions, neither the Marathon Parties nor their authorized agents are obliged to issue any public statements concerning the Company, nor undertake actions likely to necessitate a Company-related public filing, without prior written consent from the Company. However, it's important to note that this Agreement does not restrict the Marathon Parties from expressing their intended vote and rationale for such vote regarding any Extraordinary Transaction involving executive officers or directors of the Company (excluding standard support agreements), provided such voting intentions require a Company stockholder vote.

original: (e) Between the date of this Agreement and the 2021 Annual Meeting Nomination Window Date, no Marathon Party or any of their Representatives will contact or communicate with the Company or any of its Representatives (including any member of the Board) in any way or through any media other than at a Quarterly Investor Conference Call, in connection with arranging any such Quarterly Investor Conference Call or in connection with the Marathon Party’s specific rights and obligations under this Agreement. Any communications from any Marathon Party or any of their Representatives in connection with arranging any such Quarterly Investor Conference Call or in connection with the Marathon Party’s rights and obligations under this Agreement must be directed to the Parties in accordance with the notice provisions in Section 8(l) , and no Marathon Party or any of their Representatives will contact or communicate with the Company or any of its Representatives (including any member of the Board) in any other manner unless agreed to in writing by the Company.
ollama_generated: (e) From the effective date of this Agreement up until the commencement of the 2021 Annual Meeting Nomination Window, neither Marathon Party nor their Authorized Representatives shall engage in communication or interaction with the Company or its Authorized Representatives (including but not limited to members of the Board), except during Quarterly Investor Conference Calls, for the purpose of organizing such calls, or in fulfilling their specific duties and obligations under this Agreement. All communications related to arranging Quarterly Investor Conference Calls or to the Marathon Party's rights and obligations under this Agreement should be directed to the Parties as prescribed by the notice provisions in Section 8(l). Any other communication from the Marathon Party or their Authorized Representatives must receive prior written consent from the Company before it is initiated. Failure to secure such consent will render any such communication invalid.

original: 7. Press Release . The Parties agree that the Company shall issue a press release (the “ Press Release ”) in substantially the form attached hereto as Exhibit B  promptly following the execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Parties.
ollama_generated: 7. Press Release Discretion: The Parties acknowledge that, at its discretion, the Company may issue a press release (hereinafter referred to as the "Press Release") substantially similar to the form provided in Exhibit B, though its issuance is not obligatory until the Company deems appropriate, following the completion of all necessary legal procedures and due diligence, and subject to any applicable regulatory approvals.

original: (a) Specific Enforcement; Special Remedy . Each of the Parties agrees that the other Party would be irreparably injured in the event that any provision of the Agreement is breached or not performed. Accordingly, it is agreed that each Party shall be entitled to temporary and permanent injunctive relief with respect to each and any breach or purported repudiation of this Agreement by the other and to specifically enforce strict adherence to this Agreement and the terms and provisions hereof against the other in any action instituted in a court of competent jurisdiction, in addition to any other remedy which such aggrieved Party may be entitled to obtain. Moreover, in the event of the breach of any of the provisions of this Agreement, timeliness in obtaining relief is of the essence.
modified: (a) Limited Remedies; Alternative Recourse . Each of the Parties acknowledges that while damages may be available for a breach or non-performance of any provision in this Agreement, such remedy may not adequately compensate for potential losses. Thus, it is understood that neither Party shall have an entitlement to seek temporary or permanent injunctive relief with respect to each and every breach or perceived breach of this Agreement by the other. Instead, each Party agrees to pursue alternative dispute resolution methods first, in good faith, before resorting to legal action. Moreover, any delays in seeking redress for a breach shall not be held against the aggrieved Party, but timeliness is encouraged. In the event that disputes cannot be resolved through alternate means, either Party may institute an action in a court of competent jurisdiction, with this Agreement and its terms serving as the sole basis for any such action, and the non-breaching Party may seek any remedy to which it may be entitled under applicable law.

ollama_generated:
(g) Applicable Law; Forum Selection Clause.

In the event of any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, the parties hereby agree that the laws of [specific jurisdiction] shall govern such disputes. The parties further consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts located within [specific jurisdiction] for the resolution of any such disputes. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may bring an action in the courts of its domicile to seek injunctive or other equitable relief.

original: (i) This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Delaware applicable to agreements made and to be performed within that state, without giving effect to any law or principals of law that would result in the application of the laws of any other jurisdiction.
ollama_generated: (i) This Agreement shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction and interpretation of the internal laws of the State of Delaware, applicable to contracts executed and to be performed therein. Any legal concepts or principles originating from another jurisdiction that may potentially apply shall not be recognized, thereby ensuring the primacy of Delaware law in governing this Agreement.

original: (i) Severability . If at any time subsequent to the date hereof, any provision of this Agreement shall be held by any court of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, void or unenforceable, such provision shall be of no force and effect, but the illegality or unenforceability of such provision shall have no effect upon the legality or enforceability of any other provision in this Agreement.
modified: (i) Amendability . If at any point subsequent to the date herein, any provision of this Agreement is deemed by a court of appropriate jurisdiction as questionable, unlawful, or non-binding, such contested provision shall be nullified and replaced with an equivalent provision that achieves the same intent, while the validity or binding nature of other provisions within this Agreement shall remain unaffected.

original: Each Party and its counsel cooperated and participated in the drafting and preparation of this Agreement and the documents referred to herein, and any and all drafts relating thereto exchanged among the parties shall be deemed the work product of all of the parties and may not be construed against any Party by reason of its drafting or preparation. Accordingly, any rule of law or any legal decision that would require interpretation of any ambiguities in this Agreement against any Party that drafted or prepared it is of no application and is hereby expressly waived by each Party, and any controversy over interpretations of this Agreement shall be decided without regards to events of drafting or preparation. For purposes of this Agreement, the term “including” shall be deemed to be followed by the words “without limitation.” (k) Entire Agreement . This Agreement contains the entire understanding of the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof.
ollama_generated: Each Party and their respective counsel contributed to the formulation and assembly of this Agreement, as well as any related documents mentioned within, and all drafts exchanged among the parties shall be collectively regarded as each party's work product. This means that no party will be held accountable for any ambiguities in the interpretation of this Agreement due to its creation, regardless of who authored or prepared it initially. Any legal principle or judicial ruling that traditionally assigns the resolution of unclear provisions to the drafting party is explicitly waived by each Party. Disputes concerning the interpretation of this Agreement will be addressed independently of the drafting or preparation process. For the purposes of this Agreement, the term "including" shall be understood as not being limited by any specific follow-up words. (k) Complete Understanding - This Agreement encapsulates the entirety of the Parties' agreement on the matter at hand.

modified: The Obligee (hereinafter referred to as "e.l.f. Beauty, Inc.") shall have the discretionary authority to determine any adjustments or modifications in their obligations under this Agreement, provided that such changes do not materially and adversely impact the Obligator's (hereinafter referred to as the "Contracting Party") rights or interests under this Agreement without prior written consent from the Contracting Party.

original: [Signature Pages Follow] IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each of the parties hereto has executed this Agreement, or caused the same to be executed by its duly authorized representative as of the date first above written.
ollama_generated: [Signature Pages Precede] UPON THE AGREEMENT OF ALL PARTIES INVOLVED, THIS Agreement shall be deemed valid and binding upon execution by any one of the parties, their respective authorized representatives, or their successors in interest, with the first date of execution serving as the effective date.
